ticket.title: Quarantine lifecycle hardening: priority-aware eviction, saturation-safe insertion (deny), per-session quota isolation, and restart-safe persistence for fail-closed tiers

tickets.reason: Kernel should own quarantine insertion/containment actions (no-bypass).

in_scope: Add priority/severity to quarantine entries and implement priority-aware eviction.
Implement saturation-safe insertion: if quarantine is mandatory and capacity has no evictable entry, deny request (fail closed).
Implement per-session quota isolation so one adversarial session cannot exhaust global quarantine capacity.
Wire boundary-flow admission to deny on quarantine insertion failure (no 'warn and proceed').
Implement restart-safe persistence for fail-closed tiers: quarantine state MUST survive daemon restart; if storage is unavailable, fail-closed tiers MUST deny.
Implement a durable quarantine-capacity guard/reservation token interface for policies that require quarantine-on-violation for fail-closed tiers.
Ensure the guard is compatible with the canonical lifecycle: guard acquisition is consume-adjacent (part of durable consume barrier) and prevents post-effect 'cannot quarantine' states.
Ensure quarantine insert/evict is audit-bindable (HE-representable) and includes RequestId + AdmissionBundleDigest.
out_of_scope: Global quarantine federation across multiple daemons (future).

steps: Implement priority-aware eviction algorithm (expired first, then lowest priority; never evict >= incoming priority unexpired entries).
Implement quota isolation (bounded slice per session).
Implement persistent storage and restart recovery path for active quarantines.
Implement durable capacity guard API (with TTL/cleanup semantics) and integrate with kernel consume barrier.
Add adversarial flood tests + saturation tests + restart persistence tests.

criteria: Active unexpired high-severity quarantines are never evicted by lower priority entries.
Quarantine saturation causes deny when quarantine is mandatory.
Quarantine state persists across restart for fail-closed tiers.
Durable capacity guard prevents 'cannot quarantine later' for fail-closed tiers.
Adversarial flood + restart tests exist and pass in CI.
